importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the Hamas-led attack on Israel that killed Sergeant Major Tal Haimi, marking the beginning of the conflict and the context for the hostage crisis.
The signing date of the US-proposed Gaza ceasefire deal, which sets the framework for the return of deceased hostages and has become central to diplomatic efforts.
The date of the latest identification of the deceased hostage, reflecting ongoing efforts to fulfill the ceasefire agreement and maintain political momentum.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The initial 72-hour window under the ceasefire agreement for Hamas to return all deceased hostages, which has been extended due to logistical and operational challenges.
The period during which Hamas has been required to return deceased hostages under the ceasefire, with delays and misidentifications causing diplomatic tensions.

keyTakeAways: Sergeant Major Tal Haimi, a 41-year-old Israeli soldier killed on October 7, 2023, during a Hamas-led attack, has been identified as a deceased hostage returned under the ceasefire agreement.
Haimi is the 13th deceased Israeli hostage to be transferred and identified since the US-proposed ceasefire deal was signed on October 9, 2025.
Hamas is required under the ceasefire to return all deceased hostages, but Israeli intelligence assesses it may not be able to locate or recover all remaining bodies due to war-related destruction.
One previously handed-over body was misidentified and did not belong to an Israeli hostage, indicating potential lapses or mismanagement in the recovery process.
The US administration, particularly President Donald Trump, has threatened to 'eradicate' Hamas if it fails to comply with the ceasefire, signaling strong external pressure.

Diplomatic efforts, including meetings between US envoys Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner and senior Israeli military officials, are ongoing to resolve disputes and ensure compliance with the ceasefire.
The Hostages and Missing Families Forum expressed condolences to Haimi’s family, highlighting the emotional and psychological toll of the hostage situation on families.

The Israeli government, including the Prime Minister’s office and Knesset Speaker Amir Ohana, insists that the return of deceased hostages must be fulfilled 'one way or another', reinforcing political and moral urgency.

namedEntities.name: Tal Haimi
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Sergeant Major, deceased Israeli military personnel and hostage
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His identification as a deceased hostage is central to the article, representing both a personal loss and a milestone in the process of returning dead hostages under the ceasefire agreement.

namedEntities.name: Hamas
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Palestinian militant group responsible for the October 7 attack
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hamas is central to the conflict and the ceasefire process, as it is responsible for holding the hostages and must return the deceased bodies under the agreement.

namedEntities.name: Israel Defense Forces (IDF)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The IDF has confirmed the death of Tal Haimi, coordinated the identification process, and publicly demanded that Hamas return all deceased hostages.

namedEntities.name: United States
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Country acting as a mediator in the Gaza ceasefire negotiations
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The US proposed and brokered the ceasefire deal, and has used diplomatic and coercive measures (e.g., threats of force) to ensure compliance from Hamas.

namedEntities.name: Donald Trump
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: US President, a key figure in ceasefire negotiations
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Trump has publicly threatened to 'eradicate' Hamas if it violates the ceasefire, demonstrating high-level political pressure on Hamas.

namedEntities.name: Steve Witkoff
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: US special envoy to the Gaza ceasefire negotiations
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He participated in direct meetings with Israeli military leaders to discuss ceasefire compliance and recovery efforts.

namedEntities.name: Jared Kushner
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Trump’s son-in-law and key political advisor, involved in ceasefire negotiations
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He held meetings with Israeli generals to address ceasefire implementation and hostilities.

namedEntities.name: Amir Ohana
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He emphasized the necessity of fulfilling the ceasefire agreement, especially regarding the return of deceased hostages.

namedEntities.name: Red Cross
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Red Cross retrieved the remains from Gaza and transferred them to Israeli authorities for identification and burial.

namedEntities.name: Hostages and Missing Families Forum
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Advocacy group representing families of missing or deceased hostages
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The group expressed condolences to Tal Haimi’s family, highlighting the emotional impact of the situation on civilian families.

namedEntities.name: Sonthaya Oakkharasri
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Thai national previously identified as a deceased hostage
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Serves as a point of context for the sequence of identifications, showing the ongoing process of identifying deceased hostages.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Sergeant Major Tal Haimi, a 41-year-old Israeli soldier killed on October 7, 2023, during a Hamas-led attack, has been officially identified as a deceased hostage returned under the US-proposed Gaza ceasefire agreement. His identification marks the 13th such transfer since the ceasefire was signed on October 9, 2025. While the agreement requires Hamas to return all deceased hostages within 72 hours, Israeli intelligence and officials have expressed concern that Hamas may not be able to recover all bodies due to extensive war damage in Gaza. A prior body handed over by Hamas was misidentified, raising concerns about compliance. The US, particularly President Donald Trump, has threatened to 'eradicate' Hamas if it violates the agreement, adding diplomatic pressure. High-level negotiations between US envoys and Israeli military officials continue to address ceasefire violations and recovery challenges. The Hostages and Missing Families Forum has expressed deep sorrow to Haimi’s family, underscoring the human cost of the conflict.
title: Israel Identifies Body of Deceased Hostage as Sergeant Major Tal Haimi
